comment.text: Sign up with Google is a text used to describe the option to create an account using a Google account. It appears in a sign-up flow, providing clarity on how users can proceed with the registration process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Влезте чрез Google" translates to 'Log in with Google', not 'Sign up with Google'. 'Sign up' implies creating a new account.

The Lao translation "ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບດ້ວຍ Google" literally translates to "Log in with Google." The English phrase "Sign up with Google" implies creating a new account, not logging into an existing one. This is a significant semantic difference.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ສາທິດການສະຫມັກດ້ວຍ Google (Sathit kan samak duay Google)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Inscreva-se no Google' is a literal translation but doesn't convey the typical meaning of 'Sign up with Google' in a user interface context. It sounds more like 'Register in Google'.

While "Cadastre-se com Google" is understandable, "Sign up with Google" typically translates better as "Inscreva-se com Google" or "Crie sua conta com Google". "Cadastre-se" has a slightly different connotation, implying more formal registration than a simple sign-up.

The translation 'Conectare prin Google' while understandable, isn't the most natural or preferred translation for 'Sign up with Google'. 'Înregistrare cu Google' or 'Creare cont cu Google' would be more accurate and commonly used.
The translation 'Vpiši se z Google' is not the most natural or idiomatic translation of 'Sign up with Google'. While technically correct, it sounds somewhat awkward.
The translation 'Региструј се путем Google-а' is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Serbian. While technically correct, it's not the most common or elegant phrasing.
The phrase 'Google-а' uses the genitive case, which can be clunky in this context. 'Google-ом' is slightly more common and reads better.

The translation 'Registruj se putem Google-a' is a literal translation but not the most natural phrasing in Serbian. A more common and idiomatic translation would be 'Prijavi se sa Google-om' or 'Registruj se preko Google-a'.

The translation '用 Google 帐号注册' while generally understandable, is not the most natural or idiomatic translation of 'Sign up with Google'. '注册' implies a full registration process, whereas 'Sign up with Google' often refers to a simpler authentication flow.
